thread.title: Sesame Street introduces first muppet with autism
thread.title_full: Sesame Street introduces first muppet with autism

title: Sesame Street introduces first muppet with autism
text:
Temporary sign renaming of the corner of 31st Street and Eighth Avenue to "Sesame Street" February 4, 2010 outside Madison Square Garden in New York. The theater production of Sesame Street Live runs from February 4-15 at the Theater at Madison Square Garden. AFP PHOTO/Stan Honda (Photo credit should read STAN HONDA/AFP/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 95896412 (Photo: STAN HONDA, AFP/Getty Images)
13 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The newest muppet to get to Sesame Street is Julia, a preschooler with autism.
Meet @sesamestreet 's first muppet with autism https://t.co/jVxGeRXh8q pic.twitter.com/eYVeRSJhI4
— People magazine (@people) October 21, 2015 Sesame Workshop, the nonprofit educational organization behind Sesame Street , announced Wednesday that Julia is joining Elmo and the gang in books and a new app as part of the new " Sesame Street and Autism : See Amazing in All Children" campaign. The character, who "does things a little differently," according to the workshop, is part of the campaign focused on reducing the stigma of autism.
. @SesameStreet and Autism: #SeeAmazing in All Children is finally here! Visit https://t.co/gh3bhOJEGX for tools now! pic.twitter.com/oFotOwnVGb
— Sesame Workshop (@SesameWorkshop) October 21, 2015 Along with the announcement, Sesame Street shared a new video for The Amazing Song:
It has lyrics including:
"For some of us, it's hard to reach out as others do. But when you just look closer, you'll see amazingness show through. We each have our own ways to see the world and show we care. But we know we can be friends, because there's so much that we share."
Contributing: AP
